intro: Calycogonium ekmanii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing vine native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a strong fragrance to attract pollinators. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fruit that splits open to release seeds. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its unique nocturnal blooming habit and ornamental value make it a notable species in botanical gardens.
